Weight Powered Automata


2020-12-01


[WolfCatWorkshop] creates a 
weight powered automata
.
The speed is limited by the air friction of the spinning 'fly-fan' with the assembly a combination of
laser cut elements, chains and weights.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]

2020-11-27


[IoT Hub] offers a very cute 
"safe social distance habit trainer" on their Tindie store
.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




PCB Cyberpunk Construction Set


2020-11-24


[Geeek Club] has a Kickstarter for a 
cyberpunk PCB construction set

that uses 2d PCB panels soldered together to form artistic cyberpunk themed models.


The models themselves aren't moveable but the circuit boards look to have some functional LEDs.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]

[Aaron Patterson] creates 
a USB controlled terminal bell
.

permalink
)

Smarch Glasses


2020-11-13


[samsonmarch] creates a 
pair of custom smart glasses to help with GPS navigation
.




(
github
)


(
permalink
 
src

submitted by [abetusk]




3D Printed Light Marquee


2020-11-10


[Duke Doks] creates a 
3D printed light marquee
.




The fonts are extruded and the letters re-positioned to have overlap.
Each of the digits is then glued to the other, with access for the LED strip.


The LED strip is glued to the side and a 3D printed inset diffusor is positioned on
top.
Each digit has a small platform to make sure the inset diffusor is positioned correctly.


(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Beating Heart


2020-11-10


[_caseyhunt_] creates an 
Arduino powered "beating heart"
 from a Smooth-On silicon mold of a heart and a small 9g servo motor:




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Infinity Mirror RGB LED Mask


2020-11-02


[Norman Wink] uses infinity mirrors, RGB LEDs and 3D printing to create a 
Halloween mask
.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




PCB 16 Segment Display


2020-11-02


[openKolibri] creates a 
sixteen segment display
 made
of stacked PCBs.




The sixteen segment display is a 100mm x 67mm display made from four stacked PCBs, with the top
PCB being used as a diffusor.
There are 128 0603 SMT LEDs that are driven from a TM1640 driver.


See 
openKolibri's website
 for purchasing options.


(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Art Deco Earrings


2020-11-02


[sawaiz] creates 
art deco earrings
 that are motion sensitive.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]

2020-11-02


[zakqwy] creates a 
cyborg ring
.

A

Tiny PCB Violin


2020-10-25


[Alexandra Covor] creates a 
tiny violin
 that plays songs from an onboard
piezo-electic buzzer.




MIT licenced under 
GitHub
.


(
permalink
 
src
)


submitted by [abetusk]




PCB Stat Tracker


2020-10-24


[25albert] has created a 
table top role playing game (TTRPG) stat tracker
.




The board uses the PCB as a diffusor for the underlying LEDs.
In addition, the top layer PCB overhang's flex is used
to press the underlying tactile switch, creating a nicer user interface.


[25alpbert] gives credit to [
Nick Poole
] for the
clever PCB tips and tricks.


(
permalink
 
vid
)


submitted by [abetusk]




"Can The Subaltern Speak" Batting Eyelash Mask


2020-10-24


[Behnaz Farahi] gives 
details on the making of the "Can The Subaltern Speak?" mask
.




[Behnaz Farahi] writes:




This project is inspired by ... masks worn by the Bandari women from southern Iran. ... these masks were developed during Portuguese colonial rule, as a way of protecting ... from the gaze of slave masters looking for pretty women. ... from a contemporary perspective, they can be seen as ... protecting women from patriarchal colonial oppression.


Here the ‘wink’ of the sexual predator is subverted into a language to protect women from the advances of a predator. ...




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Sensor LED Ring


2020-10-24


[Joey Castillo] is working on an 
RGB LED sensor ring
.




[Joey Castillo] writes:




... it's four Dotstar LED's and an LIS2DH accelerometer. ...




Still some issues to work through though:




the big fail so far: for some reason the SPI Flash chip isn't working, so I don't have room for both the LIS3DH and Dotstar libraries ... 
running a rainbow demo, instead of reacting to motion like I'd hoped.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Ghosts and Bats Wire Pendent LEDs


2020-10-24


[
@jipraus
] creates wire ghost and bat LED pendents for halloween:




[@jiipraus] also has 
a 10-minute youtube video
 on the build.


(
permalink
 
video
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Candy Launcher


2020-10-24


[
@GeekMomProjects
] uses laser cut parts and a patchwork of
motors, gears and drums to launch mini candies.






[@GeekMomProjects] writes:




... 3D printed cylinders with grooves for the orange rubber O-rings which I purchased. It's the kind of mechanism my son's VEX robotics team usually uses when their robot has to launch projectiles, so I figured it would work for this application.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]




Singing Bowls and Servos


2020-10-24


[
Helen Leigh
] uses singing bowls, servos, LEGOs and electronics
to create tranquility.




[Helen Leigh] writes:




I'm using a #microbit, a prototype of an extremely cute #LEGO compatible microbit breakout board from @BrownDogGadgets (which u can get on Kickstarter for approximately 15 more hours) and a pair of Geek servos.




(
permalink
)


submitted by [abetusk]
docs.title: Home

docs.text: [Joris Wegner] creates an  ouija board that moves without human interaction   ( permalink )
[Joris Wegner] uses  the dead bodies of flies to create a step sequencer .   ( permalink )
[Evancli] creates a replacement  quad dashboard gauge for their Porche 914  .   Source available .  ( permalink )
[SQFMI] creates an  e-ink smartwatch   Source available for both the  software  and  hardware .  ( permalink )
[Easy HomeMade Projects] creates an  automated liquid bottle filling machine .   ( permalink )
[Charlyn] makes a  laser cut RGB LED backlit birthday card .   ( permalink )

[WolfCatWorkshop] creates a  weight powered automata .
The speed is limited by the air friction of the spinning 'fly-fan' with the assembly a combination of
laser cut elements, chains and weights.   ( permalink )
[IoT Hub] offers a very cute  "safe social distance habit trainer" on their Tindie store .   ( permalink )

[Geeek Club] has a Kickstarter for a  cyberpunk PCB construction set 
that uses 2d PCB panels soldered together to form artistic cyberpunk themed models.  The models themselves aren't moveable but the circuit boards look to have some functional LEDs.   ( permalink )
[Aaron Patterson] creates  a USB controlled terminal bell .   ( permalink )
Flexball   ( permalink )
[samsonmarch] creates a  pair of custom smart glasses to help with GPS navigation .   ( github )  ( permalink   src )

[Duke Doks] creates a  3D printed light marquee .   The fonts are extruded and the letters re-positioned to have overlap.
Each of the digits is then glued to the other, with access for the LED strip.  The LED strip is glued to the side and a 3D printed inset diffusor is positioned on
top.
Each digit has a small platform to make sure the inset diffusor is positioned correctly.  ( permalink )
[_caseyhunt_] creates an  Arduino powered "beating heart"  from a Smooth-On silicon mold of a heart and a small 9g servo motor:   ( permalink )
[Norman Wink] uses infinity mirrors, RGB LEDs and 3D printing to create a  Halloween mask .   ( permalink )

[openKolibri] creates a  sixteen segment display  made
of stacked PCBs.   The sixteen segment display is a 100mm x 67mm display made from four stacked PCBs, with the top
PCB being used as a diffusor.
There are 128 0603 SMT LEDs that are driven from a TM1640 driver.  See  openKolibri's website  for purchasing options.  ( permalink )
[sawaiz] creates  art deco earrings  that are motion sensitive.   ( permalink )
[zakqwy] creates a  cyborg ring .   ( permalink )
[Chelsea Klukas] creates a full face mask of RGB LEDs (for ~$160)   ( permalink )
A DIY and free/libre version of a  split flap display   ( permalink   src )
A  mini word clock  that could potentially be used as a wrist watch.   ( permalink )

[Alexandra Covor] creates a  tiny violin  that plays songs from an onboard
piezo-electic buzzer.   MIT licenced under  GitHub .  ( permalink   src )

[25albert] has created a  table top role playing game (TTRPG) stat tracker .   The board uses the PCB as a diffusor for the underlying LEDs.
In addition, the top layer PCB overhang's flex is used
to press the underlying tactile switch, creating a nicer user interface.  [25alpbert] gives credit to [ Nick Poole ] for the
clever PCB tips and tricks.  ( permalink   vid )

docs.text: [Behnaz Farahi] gives  details on the making of the "Can The Subaltern Speak?" mask .   [Behnaz Farahi] writes:   This project is inspired by ... masks worn by the Bandari women from southern Iran. ... these masks were developed during Portuguese colonial rule, as a way of protecting ... from the gaze of slave masters looking for pretty women. ... from a contemporary perspective, they can be seen as ... protecting women from patriarchal colonial oppression.  Here the ‘wink’ of the sexual predator is subverted into a language to protect women from the advances of a predator. ...   ( permalink )

[Joey Castillo] is working on an  RGB LED sensor ring .   [Joey Castillo] writes:   ... it's four Dotstar LED's and an LIS2DH accelerometer. ...   Still some issues to work through though:   the big fail so far: for some reason the SPI Flash chip isn't working, so I don't have room for both the LIS3DH and Dotstar libraries ... 
running a rainbow demo, instead of reacting to motion like I'd hoped.   ( permalink )
